intro: Hypochaeris hispidula, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Hypochaeris hispidula is often considered a weed but can also serve as a food source for certain insects.
